sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Consider the figure given below. In this figure we have \(FG \parallel EJ \), and \(FH \parallel EK \). Now, prove that \(GH \parallel JK \).
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
$$\text{In the triangle IJE , we have $FG \parallel EJ $. So, we can write that}$$
\[
	\frac{G\input[s1v1]{} }{GJ } = \frac{IF }{\input[s1v2]{}E }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
$$\text{Now, again in triangle IKE , we have $FH \parallel EK $. So, we can write}$$
\[
	\frac{IF }{FE } = \frac{I\input[s2v1]{} }{\input[s2v2]{}K }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
From the above two equations, we get
\[
	\frac{\input[s3v1]{}G }{GJ } = \frac{\input[s3v2]{}H }{HK }
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Thus, in the triangle IJK we can write 
\[
	\frac{IG }{\input[s4v1]{}\input[s4v2]{}} = \frac{IH }{HK }
\]

"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{Which means $GH \parallel JK $. Hence proved.}$$
\newline
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["I", "F"], "text": "$$\text{In the triangle IJE , we have $FG \parallel EJ $, therefore, from the basic proportionality theorem $\frac{IG }{GJ } = \frac{IF }{FE }$.}$$"}, {"data": ["H", "H"], "text": "$$\text{In the triangle IKE , we have $FH \parallel EK $, therefore, again using the basic proportionality theorem $\frac{IF }{FE } = \frac{IH }{HK }$.}$$ "}, {"data": ["I", "I"], "text": "$$\text{Using property, if $a = b$, and $a = c$, then $b = c$, therefore, from the above results we can write $\frac{IG }{GJ } = \frac{IH }{HK }$}$$"}, {"data": ["G", "J"], "text": "$$\text{Using converse of Thale's Theorem we can say that in the triangle $IJK$, if $\frac{IG }{GJ } = \frac{IH }{HK }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
